alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Perry; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 2:31PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Harlan, southern Leslie, northern Letcher, southeastern Perry, southern Knott, southeastern Floyd and southwestern Pike Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 230 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Demo to Spider to near Viper to Skidmore. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bath, Wayland, Orkney, Pine Top, Price, Cornettsville, Spider, Mallie, Hi Hat and East McDowell around 235 PM EDT. Pippa Passes, Vicco, Drew, May, Nealy, Omaha, Ulvah, Colson, Ligon and Hollybush around 240 PM EDT. Arminta, Ivan, Craynor, Red Star, Bluefield, Gander, Beaver, Buckhorn Hollow, Kite and Hallie around 245 PM EDT. Letcher, Blackey, Hall, Galveston, Greenleaf, Carcassonne, Indian Bottom, Elko, Dry Creek and Osborn around 250 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Wheelwright, Chappell, Jeremiah, David, Carbon Glow, Halo, Hot Spot, Premium, Amelia, Redfox, Pikeville, Van, Speight, Isom, Napier, Sackett, Trailer, Melvin, Oscaloosa, McRoberts, Whitesburg, Shelbiana, Chloe, Tillie, Crown, Bellcraft, Marlowe, Big Fork, Causey, Beefhide, Southdown, Myra, Jonancy, Garden Village, Big Rock, Big Laurel, Polly, Lucastown, Lester and Raccoon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Harlan; Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Perry; Pike
